qas.question: What is a property of objects which can be transferred to other objects or converted into different forms?
In SI units, energy is measured in what measurement?
Mechanically, one joule is defined as what?

answers.text: the energy transferred to an object by the mechanical work of moving it a distance of 1 metre against a force of 1 newton

qas.question: What is a property of objects which can be transferred to other objects or converted into different forms in biology?
In SI units, what is measured in watts?
electronuclear is a definition of what?
How many meters of chemical work is required?

plausible_answers.text: thermal energy, radiant energy, electromagnetic, nuclear

qas.question: What definitions are there for types of energy, regardless of context?

context: In <b3_0>physics<b3_0/>, <a0_0>energy<a0_0/> is a property of objects which can be transferred to other objects or converted into different forms. The "ability of a system to perform work" is a common description, but it is difficult to give one single comprehensive definition of energy because of its many forms. For instance, in SI units, <b4_0>energy<b4_0/> is measured in <a1_0>joules<a1_0/>, and one joule is defined "mechanically", being <a2_0>the energy transferred to an object by the mechanical work of moving it a distance of <b6_0>1 metre<b6_0/> against a force of 1 newton<a2_0/>.[note 1] However, there are many other definitions of <b5_0>energy<b5_0/>, depending on the context, such as <b7_0>thermal energy, radiant energy, electromagnetic, nuclear<b7_0/>, etc., where definitions are derived that are the most convenient.
